description: Design system enforces calm, ceremonial visual style across platform and wedding site
steps: Open platform UI and wedding site UI
Verify visual style is minimal and calm (no dense UI)
Verify no playful or gimmicky UI elements exist (no mascot graphics, no loud colors, no novelty animations)
Verify whitespace is intentionally used (sections are visually separated and not crowded)
Verify the guest-facing pages feel warmer than admin pages (tone and spacing)

description: Colors are restricted to curated palettes with accessibility-safe contrast
steps: Open template editor for a wedding
Verify users can only choose from curated palettes (not arbitrary hex input)
Verify each template palette has: 1 primary, 1 accent, 2 neutrals (light and dark)
Verify no pure black (#000000) or pure white (#FFFFFF) are used in UI tokens
Verify no neon saturated colors are available
Verify text contrast is readable on all primary surfaces

description: Typography is locked per template and cannot be customized arbitrarily
steps: Open template settings for a wedding
Verify there is no font upload UI
Verify there is no freeform font picker
Verify headings (names, titles) use a template-defined serif style
Verify body text uses a template-defined sans serif style
Verify typography remains consistent after switching templates

description: Layout guardrails prevent ugly outcomes
steps: Verify there is no freeform drag-and-drop canvas
Verify sections can be toggled on/off and reordered only
Verify spacing remains consistent regardless of content edits
Verify no inline styles or ad-hoc px values are used in UI components

description: Microcopy uses human, calm language and avoids technical phrasing
steps: Verify message reads like 'RSVPs are currently closed for this event' (not 'Feature disabled')
Trigger a failed save state in admin UI
Verify error message is gentle and actionable (not technical or alarming)
Verify labels use human wording (e.g., 'Your guests', 'Your invitations', 'Your site') and avoid 'Manage', 'Entities', 'Records'

description: Motion is minimal and only used for feedback (no dramatic animations)
steps: Navigate through platform UI and wedding site UI
Verify there are no bouncing, sliding panels, or dramatic transitions
Verify only minimal feedback motion exists (subtle fade, hover, loading shimmer)
Verify no animation blocks interaction or draws attention

description: Guest RSVP UI is mobile-first with large tap targets and one-question-per-block layout
steps: Open RSVP page on a mobile viewport
Verify primary question appears clearly at top (e.g., 'Will you be joining us?')
Verify options are large and easy to tap
Verify party size uses a stepper control, not a tiny input
Verify dietary notes are optional and not above the fold
Submit RSVP and verify confirmation screen feels celebratory and calm (not transactional)

description: Guest photo upload UI is minimal and memory-oriented with one primary action
steps: Open photo upload page on mobile viewport
Verify there is one clear primary CTA (e.g., 'Add photos')
Verify progress is shown per file
Verify retry is possible for failed uploads
Verify no account or login requirement is presented

description: Admin navigation is minimal and never exceeds 6 primary items
steps: Verify navigation shows no more than 6 primary items
Verify there is no nested sidebar navigation
Verify RSVP nav item is hidden
Verify Photos nav item is hidden

description: Template categories exist and match product positioning
steps: Verify template categories exist: Minimal, Classic, Modern, Destination, Cultural
Verify each category contains at least one template option
Verify templates can be previewed before selection

description: Admin can log in via magic link
Admin dashboard loads with no wedding selected
steps: Verify empty state prompts to create or select a wedding

description: Stripe checkout session can be created for a new wedding
steps: Verify checkout session is created successfully

description: Successful Stripe checkout provisions a wedding
Wedding site render_config is generated on provisioning
steps: Verify render_config contains enabled feature flags

description: Wedding site renders exclusively from render_config
steps: Navigate to public wedding site URL
Verify page loads using render_config only
Verify no direct database joins are used in site rendering

description: Template can be switched without losing content
steps: Verify content remains intact with new template

description: Feature selection step available during wedding setup
Disabling RSVP hides RSVP on public site
steps: Disable RSVP feature for a wedding
Verify RSVP CTA is not visible
Verify friendly 'RSVP disabled' message is shown

description: Disabling RSVP blocks RSVP API endpoints
Admin can add invitees manually
Admin can import invitees via CSV
steps: Upload CSV with name and email

description: Admin can send invitation emails
Guest can view RSVP form via tokenized link
Guest can submit RSVP
Guest can edit RSVP using same link
Admin can view RSVP summary
steps: Verify counts for attending, not attending, no response

description: Photo upload feature can be enabled
steps: Verify photo upload CTA appears on site
Verify photo upload page is accessible

description: Guest can upload photos via signed URLs
Uploaded photo metadata is stored
steps: Verify metadata record exists in database
Verify admin can see uploaded photo list

description: Admin can create announcement banner
Announcement banner displays on public site
steps: Verify banner appears at top of page
Verify title and message match admin input

description: Reminder emails are sent via worker queue
steps: Verify jobs are enqueued in Redis
